concept.title: SDIO Interface Quick Start
concept.shortdesc: Provides a collection of documents that describe the SDIO client interface API.

section.title: SDIO tutorials
section.p: The client interface guide describes the generic procedure for using SDIO in a kernel-side device driver.
The Bluetooth example describes a reference client driver using Bluetooth
The other tutorials describe the SDIO classes and commands in more detail

section.title: Purpose
section.p: SDIO is an input/output protocol used to communicate with SDIO (Secure Digital) cards and other media such as Bluetooth adapters and GPS receivers.

section.title: Intended audience
section.p: This document is intended to be used by device driver writers.

conbody.section: ArchitectureSymbian platform implements SDIO as part of a larger framework involving SD cards, which are a type of MMC (multimedia) card. For this reason, to use SDIO in a device driver you will need to use classes representing SD and MMC cards and the associated communications stack even if you only want the basic I/O functionality.
